Description:
Lead the technical project management of electrical projects, overseeing the entire project lifecycle, from design and planning to execution and commissioning.
Design and develop complex electrical systems and components for a wide range of projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations.
Perform detailed analysis, testing, and troubleshooting of electrical systems to identify and resolve technical challenges and ensure optimal performance for AC and telecom DC systems.
Mentor and provide technical guidance to junior electrical engineers, supporting their professional development and growth within the company.
Prepare comprehensive project documentation, including technical drawings, schematics, specifications, and operation manuals.
Review and approve electrical designs, calculations, and engineering reports prepared by other team members or external consultants.
Manage project budgets and timelines, ensuring projects are completed on time and within budget constraints.
Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to understand their needs and provide expert advice on electrical solutions to meet their requirements effectively.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in electrical engineering with a proven track record of successful project management.
In-depth knowledge of electrical systems, power distribution, control systems, and related engineering principles.
Proficiency in engineering software such as AutoCAD, Revit, Ecodial, or similar tools.
Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills to effectively lead project teams and collaborate with stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex engineering challenges and make informed decisions in a fast-paced environment.
Experience in telecom DC systems ( recertifies and batteries ).
Business writing skills , prepare technical RFP response & compliancy sheet.
